qas.question: When was Scotland invaded by William?
Who invaded Scotland in the 10th century?
Who did the Scotish king take hostage?

context: One of the claimants of the English throne opposing William the Conqueror, <a0_0><a0_2>Edgar<a0_0/> Atheling<a0_2/>, eventually fled to Scotland. <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>King Malcolm III<a1_2/><a1_1/> of Scotland<a1_0/> married <a0_1>Edgar<a0_1/>'s sister <b4_0>Margaret<b4_0/>, and came into opposition to William who had already disputed Scotland's southern borders. <b5_0>William<b5_0/> invaded Scotland in <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>1072<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, riding as far as Abernethy where he met up with his fleet of ships. Malcolm submitted, paid homage to William and surrendered his son <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b6_0>Duncan<b6_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> as a hostage, beginning a series of arguments as to whether the Scottish Crown owed allegiance to the King of England.
